title: Arco Studio vs Arco Studio Pro
comparison_headline: How much machine do you actually need?
comparison_intro: Both machines share DNA — dual boilers, saturated group heads, and build quality that's built to outlast trends. The Studio Pro adds flow control, shot profiling software, and details borrowed from competition machines. Whether that matters depends entirely on how you brew.
hero_image_alt: Arco Studio and Arco Studio Pro espresso machines on a polished concrete countertop, the Pro slightly taller with its visible flow control paddle, both in matte black, a bottomless portafilter resting between them showing crema on a recent extraction, dramatic directional lighting

boiler_type.product_a: Dual boiler, saturated group head (brass throughout)
boiler_type.product_b: Dual boiler, saturated group head (brass throughout), thermally insulated

pressure_control.product_b: Adjustable OPV + flow control paddle with real-time pressure gauge

steam_capability.product_a: High-capacity steam boiler (800 ml), articulating cool-touch wand
steam_capability.product_b: High-capacity steam boiler (1,000 ml), articulating cool-touch wand, dry steam mode

grind_compatibility.product_a: Stepless grinder essential (Preciso minimum, Zero ideal)
grind_compatibility.product_b: Competition-grade grinder strongly recommended (Zero or equivalent)

suitable_for.product_a: Serious home baristas who want pre-infusion control and saturated group stability without complexity overload
suitable_for.product_b: Advanced home baristas and competition hobbyists who want full flow control, shot profiling data, and no ceiling on experimentation

not_suitable_for.product_a: Anyone who needs flow control profiling or wants to log and compare shot data digitally
not_suitable_for.product_b: Anyone who doesn't already understand pressure profiling — the Pro's features will be expensive decoration without the technique to use them

craft-barista.rationale: If you are already profiling shots and want real-time flow data to refine your technique, the Pro gives you tools that the Studio simply doesn't have.

upgrader.rationale: The Studio already represents a major step up — the Pre-infusion lever alone will keep you learning for months before you would need what the Pro offers.

verdict: The Studio is a genuinely professional-grade machine that most home baristas will never outgrow. The Studio Pro is for the small percentage of people who have outgrown pre-infusion levers and want paddle-based flow control with data logging. If you have to ask whether you need the Pro, you probably don't — yet. Start with the Studio and let your technique tell you when it is time.
